l.quote: Beatus vir qui non abiit in consilio

lg.l: Seli bern ẏat noght is gane
In ẏe rede of wicked mane
Ne in strete of sinful noht ne stode
Ne sat in setel of storm vngode
Bot in lagh of Louerd his wil be aẏ
And his lagh ẏink he night and daẏ
And al his lif so sal he be
Als it fares bẏ a tre
ẏat streme of water standes neir
ẏat gifs his fruit in tẏme of ẏere
And lef of him to dreue ne sal
What so he mas sal soundeful al
Noht so wicked men noght so
Bot als dust þat wind ẏe eirẏe tas fra
And ẏarfor wicke in dome noght rise
Ne sinful in rede of rightwise
For Louerd of rightwise wote ẏe waẏ
And gate of wike forwurth sal aẏ
Blisse to ẏe fader and to ẏe sone
And to ẏe haligast wil with ẏam wune
Als first was is and aẏ sal be
In werld of werldes to ẏe thre
Qwarfor gnaistes gomes so
And folkes vnnait ẏhat ẏai ẏho
Vpstoden kẏnges of ẏe lande
And ẏ princes hand in hande
Again ẏair god ẏai come on one
And ogaẏne ẏar crist to gone
Bandes of ẏaime breke we aẏ
And fr vs cast ẏar ẏoke awaẏ
ẏat wones in heuen he scorn ẏam sal
And Lauerd sal ẏam swere with al
ẏan sal be speke to ẏam in wragh
And to dreue am sal he in his wragh
I sothlic set am for ẏi
King fro him ful witerli
Ouer Sẏon hille heli hisse
Spelland his bode with mikel blisse
Louerd to me saẏde mi sone ẏou hate
And .i. I me seluen to daẏ ẏe gate
Aske of me and i giue ẏe sal
Folkes fele wele more with al
ẏin eritage al in ẏi hande
And ẏin aght meres of lande
Stere ẏam in erith ẏerd sal to so
And als lome of erẏe brek sal tou ẏo
And nou kẏnges leres and tas ẏeme
ẏe ẏe whilk ẏat landes deme
Serues to god in drede
And with qwaking glades him al
Gripes lore lestē Louerd wrogh be
And fro right wai forwurth ẏhe
When en short his wrath to brunt is so
ẏat in him traist al seli ẏho
Louerd hou manifolded er ẏho
ẏat droune me and do me wo
Felle rise againe fel saine ẏis
To mi saul nis hele ẏai in god hisse
Mi fonger Louerd soghlic ar tou
Mi blisse and mi heued vp heuand nou
With mi steuen to Louerd i cried shril
And herd me of his heli hille
I slep and sober i al for ẏi
And Louerd me fonged vp rase i
I ne sal noght dred a ẏhousand
Of folk ẏat me are amanges vmgiuand
Rise vp Louerd ẏou maẏ best
Sauf me mi god and giue me rest
Sothlic ẏou smot with ẏi hande
Al to me wiẏerwendande
Withouten sake or am shill
Tegh of sinful bretnest ille
Of Louerd it is heling
And ouer ẏi folke be ẏi blissing

l.quote: Cum invocarem exaudivit me Deus iustitie

lg.l: When .i. I cal god of mi rihtnes me herd he
In drouing to breddest to me
Haue merci of me in ẏe stede
And with ẏin eren here mi bede
Mensones towhen of hert vnmek
Whi loue fantum and liẏhes seke
And wit ẏe louerd his hali he sekouthed he
When .i. I to him cal Louerd sal here me
Wraghes and ne wiles noght sinne
Whilk ẏour hertes sain with wine
And in ẏour clenes ẏou betwene
More ẏat ẏe stungen bene
Offres offrand of rightwisnes
Traistes in louerd more and lesse
Fele saine whil ẏat ẏai liue
Who sal goddes shew or giue
Louerd light of ẏi lickam tokned ouer us es
ẏou gaf into mi hert finnes
Of fruit of whet of his holi and wine
Are ẏai manifaulded ẏne
In pais ī him self is best
Both ẏen sal i slep and rest
For ẏou Louerd sengelli
In hope me set ful witerli
Mi wordes Louerd with eres bese
And vnderstand ẏe cri of me
Of mi bede behald te steuen
Mi king and mi god of heuen
For Louerd to ẏe besek sal .I. I
Mi steuen sal tou here erli
I sal erli to ẏe se and stand
For ẏou nert god wicnes willand
Ne wic sal noght wun be ẏe
Ne unrightwise before ẏin eẏen be
ẏat wirk wicnesse ẏou hated ẏo
Alle ẏat lihes spek ẏou leses als so
Mensloers and swikel Louerd wlat sal
And .i. I mikelhed of ẏi mercẏ al
Into ẏi hous in go sal .I. I
At ẏi heli kirk in ẏi dred beseke for ẏi
Louerd in ẏi rightwisnes lede me aẏ
And for mi fos in ẏi sight right mi wai
For noht is in ẏar mough soghnes

i t isse

h is ful of wo

Output ẏam ẏai sal be

l.quote: Domine ne in furore tuo arguas

lg.l: Louerd ẏrep me noht in ẏi bragh
Ne ouertak me noht in ẏi wragh
Miles of me Louerd for seke am .I. I
Mi bones ar dreued hele me for ẏi

Twin louErd and mi saul outtak
For ẏi mercẏ saufe me make
For in ded ne is whilk is mined of ẏe

I swank in mi sighing sted
Be al nihtes sal i wasse mi bed
With teres of mine eẏen two
Ssal .i. I wete mi straile so
Fro bragh min eẏen is let for ẏi
Betwix mi fos al elded .I. I
Wites fro me al whilk wirk wic ẏing
For Louerd herd steuen of mi weping
Mi beseking Louerd herd he

Al sham and to dreue mi fos radli
ẏai be turned and sham swiẏe swifteli

l.quote: Domine deus meus in te speravi [salvum me fac]

lg.l: Louerd mi god .I. I hoped in ẏe
And for ẏi sauf mak ẏou me

Ne quenne rob he als lion
Saule mine to bring it doun
Whilk ẏat bies whilk non isse
Ne whilk ẏat makes sauf to blisse
Louerd mi god if i do ẏis
Whore wickednesse in mi hend is
If i ẏeld ẏeldand me wiles i fal
Gilti fro mi fos vnnait al
Filies saul min ẏe fo
And gripes and to dredes als so
In erẏe mi lif and mi blisse with wo
In dust ledes ẏar it come fro
Vprise Louerd in wragh ẏine
And vp h endes heue eue endes of fos mine
And rise Louerd mi god in bode ẏou send to be
and kirke of folkes sal vmgif ẏe
And for ẏat agaẏn turne in heght
Louerd demes folk right
Deme Louerd after mi rightwisnes
And ouer me after min vndrandnes
For in night of sinful be
And stere sal tou rightwise to ẏe
Ransakand ẏar hertes klene
And ẏar neres god bidene
Right help min fro Louerd in quert
Whilk man sauf rightwise of hert
God demer right ẏholand and strAnge
Non what is wraghed be daies lang
Bot ẏe turne he shakes his swerd of stel

He bent his bogh and graiẏed
it wele

Sh
unfonged sore and bar wicnes
ẏe slogh he opened and it grof with spade
And he fel in dike whilk ẏat he made
In his heued bi turned his sorv with al

And sing to Louerd name heghist isse

lg.l: Louerd our louerd hou selkouth isse

With blisse and menske ẏou cROned him r ẏ et

Trone his als so and he

Deme sal he folk in rightwisnes

ẏin louinges euerilkan

ẏholmodnes of pouer ẏat are
Forwurgh in end sal neuer mare

ẏai are gripen in redes whilk ẏai ẏhot tis

In al tim his waies filed bene
Outborn for his face ẏe domes be
Ouer al his fos Louerd sal he

vnder tunges of him als so
Swink and sorw and mikel wo

In ẏi hende ẏat ẏou gif ẏo
ẏe pouer beleft is to ẏe

ẏorninges of pouer here louerd who ferd
Forgraiẏing of ẏar hert ẏin ere herd

And heghist he gaf his steuen
Haghil colde was doun falland
And coles of fire ohot gloẏeand
And he shot his arwes and scaterd ẏo
ẏunner manifold and dreued am so
And shewden welles of watres ẏare
And groundes of erẏel werld vnhild are
Ob snibbinge Louerd mine
Of in sprout of gaft of wragh ẏine
He send fro heghist hand he man me
And of wattres fele me vptok he
He out name me ẏar amanges
For mi fos war ouer stranges
Fro ẏe whilk hates me to se
For ẏai ar strenẏed ouer me
ẏai forth come me in dai of mi tininge
And mad his Louerd mi forhilinges
And he me led in bred to be
Sauf mad he me for he wald me

l.quote: Et retri[buet mihi ; mearum retribuet mihi]

lg.l: And Louerd to me ẏeld he sal
After mi rightwisnes al
And after klennes of mi hend
ẏeld to me klennes at ẏe end
For i ẏemed Louerd wais to gon ine
Ne wicli did i fr god mine
For al his domes in mi siht ai
And his rightwisnes fro me noht .i. I awai
And i sal be with him wemeles
And ẏeme me fro mi wickednes

l.quote: Et [retribuet mihi ; in conspectu oculorum eius]

lg.l: And Louerd ẏheld to me sal he
After rightwisnes of me
After klennes of mi hend als so
In sight of his eẏen two

l.quote: Cum sancto sanctus eris [et cum viro innocente innocens eris]

lg.l: With heli dwel heli bes of tho
With man vnderand vnderand be
With chosen men chese ẏe munn
With wicke bes tou ẏif ẏou wune
For ẏou folk mek make sal
And eẏen of proude meke with al
For mi lantern lightes tou
Louerd mi god light mi mirknes nou
For in ẏe be .i. I out ganges of fonding al
and in mi god sal i ouer fare ẏe walle
Mi god vnfiled is ẏe wai
Speche of Louerd is fonded ai
With fir for hiler is he
Of al in him ẏat hopand be
For who bot god Louerd we cal
Who god bot our god of al
God þat miht gird me with ai
And vnu wemmed set in wai
ẏat als of hertes mad mi fete to be
And ouer heghnes settand me
ẏat leres mi hend to fight þat was
and tou mad min armes als bogh of brasse
And tou gaf me forhilinge of hel of ẏe
And ẏi righthand on fonged on me
And ẏi lore in end me in ended al
And ti lore ite lere me sale
ẏou breddest mi goines vnder me
And mi steppes moht vnfest ẏai be
I sal filiẏe mi fos and vmgripe ẏo
And to ẏa wones again ẏoht sal i go
I sal ẏam brek ne stand ẏai miht
ẏai sal fal doune vnder mi fet right
And tou gird me amanges
With miht to sight ẏat was stranges
And tou vnderlaide risande
In me vnder me to stande
And mi fos of bak ẏou gaf me so
And hatand me ẏou forlesed ẏo
ẏai cried ne was ẏat sauf mad oht
To Louerd and he ne herd am noht
I sal to sinde ẏame
Ans dust before ẏe wind lickam
Als ẏat is in wai ẏe fenne
For do ẏam i sal awai
Fro folk gain sanges me outtak ẏou sal
Me set in heued of genge with al
Folk serued me whilk i kneu no dele
In heringe of ere it be houed me wele
Outen sones serued me ẏare
Outen sones vnhelded are
And tai halted ẏer ẏai ẏode
Fro ẏi stiẏes ẏat are gode
Louerd liues and mi god blissid be
And god of mi hele vphouen be he
God ẏat wrekes giues me mo
And vndres flok vnder me so
Mi leser ẏou art ai whare
Of mi fos wraghli ẏat are
And fro in me risand heue me ẏou sal
Fro lan wic outta me al

l.quote: [Propterea confitebor tibi in nationibus Domine et psalmum dicam]

lg.l: I sal shriue in burẏhes to ẏe for ẏi
Louerd and to ẏi name psalm sai sal .i. I
Heles of his kinges mikeland
And merci als so doand
Til his crist is of dauid
And to his sed til in werld ẏar with

l.quote: Celi ennarrant gloriam Dei et opera [mannum]

lg.l: Heuens tellen goddes blisse
And wolken shewes handwerk hisse
Dai to dai word rist right
And wisdo[m] h shewes niht to niht
ẏai nare speches ne sayes euen
Of whilk þat noht is herd ẏar steuen
In al ẏe werld out yode ẏar rode
And in ende of erẏe of ẏam worde
In sunne he set his telde to stande
And he als bride come of his bour command
He gladed als eten to rin ẏe wai
Fro heghest heuen his cominge out ai
And his gain rynninge til hegh set
Ne is whilk mai hide him fro his hete
Lagh of Louerd vn[w]emed isse
Turnand saules in to blisse
Witnes of Louerd is euer treu
Wisdome leuand to liltil neu
Louerdes rightwisnes rhit hertes fainand
Bode of Louerd is light eyen lihtand
Dred of Louerd it heli isse
In wherld of werld ai ful of blisse
Domes of louErd ful sothe ar ai
Rightes in ẏam selfe are ẏai
More to be yorned ouer golde
Or ston dere wurẏi þat is holde
Wele swetter to manes wombe
Ouer honi and te combe
and ẏi hin sal am ẏem on al ẏinges
In ẏam yemand mikel yeminges
Guilte who vnderstandes of midnes klens me
And fro outen spare ẏi hine wil be
If noht ẏai Louerd of me ẏen vnwemMed be .I. I
And i bensed of mikel gilt for ẏi
And ẏat speche of mi mough qui sal ẏai
And ẏhot of mi hert in ẏi sight ai
ẏou Louerd in helper out of wo
Mi forhiler he is als so

l.quote: Exaudiat te Dominus in die tribulatonis

lg.l: Here ye Louerd in drouing dai
Nam of god iacob forhile ẏe ai
Fro heli send help on on
And he be help ẏe fro [fro repetition] syon
Of al ẏin offrande mined be he
And ẏin offrand fat maked be
He giue to ẏe after ẏe hert
And ẏi red he fest in qwert
We sal be fained in hele of ẏe
And in nam of our god mikeld be
Fulfil al ẏi bodes Louerd with blisse
Nou kneu .i. I ẏat saufe mad Louerd crist hisse
Of his heli heuen he be him herand
In mihtandes of hele of his righthande
ẏai in waines and ẏai in horses alle
And we in name of Louerd our go[d error ms b] sal cal
ẏai are bunden and fellen sare
And we rose and righted are
Louerd make saufe ẏe king to be
And here us in what dai we haue cald ẏe

l.quote: Domine in virtute tua letabitur rex [et super salutare]

lg.l: Louerd in ẏi miht ẏe king faine sal
And ouer ẏi hele swiẏe glade with al
you gafe him ẏorning after hert and ẏhot
And of wil of his lippes ẏou swiked him noht
For ẏou befor come him swo
In blissinges of swetnes to go
ẏou set in his heued on on
ẏe kroune of a derwurthi ston
He aske ẏe life and tou gaf him strengh
In werld and in werld of daies lengh
Mikel of him it is ẏe blisse
In ẏe hele so gode ẏat isse
Blisse and mikel fairhed wih alle
Ouer him on.sette ẏou sal
For he salt giue him in blissinge
In werld of werld for be al ẏinge
Faine sal tou him in mirh dai and niht
With ẏi lickam faire an bright
For ẏe king in Louerd hopes he
And in mikel of heghist noht stired sal he be
ẏi hand be funden in ẏin ilwiland
And al ẏat he hat find ẏi righthand
ẏou salt am set in heuen o fire
In time of ẏi lickam shire
Louerd in ẏi wragh to drene sal yo two
And swolie am fire it sal als swo
ẏar fruit fro erẏe for les tou sal
And fro men sons ẏar sede alle
For ẏai helded in ẏe me les ẏai ẏhot
Redes whilk staiẏel ẏai miht noht
For on bak sal tou seite am
In ẏar rerlicked forẏarke yar licham
Vpheue Louerd in ẏew of ẏe
In ẏi mihtes singe and spalm sal we

l.quote: Deus Deus meus respice in me

lg.l: God mi god in me be se
Qwerfor forletedest tou me
Hele min ful fer ẏe fro
Wordesof mi giltes mo
Mi god i sal cri be dai
And tou sal tou noht here what .I. I sai
And be niht ẏif ẏat it be
And noht til vnwisdom to me
ẏou sohlic in haliwelle
Wones lof of irale
Our fadres in ẏe hoped ẏai
ẏai hoped and tou lesed am ai
Te to ẏe ẏai cried and sau ẏai ware
In ẏe ẏai hoped and noht shent ẏai are
And i am wurme and man no ẏhinge
Men vpbraiding and folk outfestinge
Men seand me scornd ẏai
With lippes ẏai spak and heued stird ẏai
He hoped in Louerd he outnim him
Sauf made he him for he wald him
For ẏou art whilk me out drogh
Of ẏe wombe in hope inogh
Fro pappes of ẏe moder of me
Fro magh forkasten .i. I am in ẏe
Fro wombe of mi moder in god artou
Ne wite ẏou noht fro me nou
For ẏat drouinge is nes hand
And is none ẏat is helpand
Vmgaf me ful mani calues
Fat boles vmset me on al halues
ẏar mough ouer me ẏai wore openand
Als lion rarand and romiand
Als watter ẏotte i am at ones
And to spred are al min bones
Als waux melt and mÂd is mi hert
In mid mi wonbe for mikel vnquert
Wil wid als a pot miht be
Might min wit nine me
And mi tunges kleued to checes rede
And tou me led in dust of dede
Mi hend and mi fete ẏai dolued wide
ẏai told min bones on ikla side
ẏai soghlic be helden so
In in lokeden me ẏo
ẏai delt am mi shrendes ilkon
And kleẏing mine set bote apone
At mi weringe ẏou be se
And tou Louerd fert noht ẏi help fro
Outtak fro swerd saule mine
And fro hand of hund oninges mine
Saufe me fro mouth of lionesse
And fro hornes of vnicorns mine onesse
ẏi name mi breẏer tel i sal
In mid ẏe kẏrke loue ẏe with all
Whilk dredes louerd loues him
Alle sede of iacob mirthes him
Euer mor him mot it dred
ẏat is of irael ẏe sede
For he forsok for nothinges
Ne forsegh of pouer besekinge
Ne he turnes his face fro me
And when .i. I to him cried me herde
To ẏe mi lof with mirẏe and blisse
In ẏe kirke ẏat mikel isse
Mi hotes sal i ẏeld ful right
Of him dred and in ẏe sight
Ete mot pouer and fild be so
And loue Louerd sal ẏai ẏo
ẏat him seke for saule quertes
In werld of werld sal liue ẏar hertes
ẏai be mined and turned ẏare
To Louerd al endes of erẏe ẏat are
And bid in his sight sal ẏai
Alle him of genges aẏ
For ẏat Louerd is te rike
And sal Louerd of genge ilike
ẏai eten and boden ẏore
Alle fattes of erẏe ẏat wore
Fal sal ẏai in sight hisse
Alle whilk dounstihe in erẏe isse
And mi saule til him liue sal
And serue to him in sede sal al
Sheu sal to Louerd strend to ward isse
And shew sal heuenes his rightwisnes
To ẏe folk ẏat born sal be
Whilk ẏat Louerd maked he

l.quote: Dominus regit me et nichil michi [deerit ; In loco pascue]

lg.l: Louerd me steres noht want sal me
In sted of fod ẏar me louke he
He foẏered me on watter of fode
Mi saule he uurnes in to go se
He lede me on stihes of rightwisnes
For his name yat heli esse
For and if i go middes shadw of ded
For you with me art i ne iueles sal drede
ẏi yerd and yai staf yar to
Mikel roninge ẏai me do
ẏou graiẏed in mi sight bord to be
Againe ẏo ẏat drouen me
Mi heued in olie maked tou fat
Mi drink drokinand hou shire is yat
And filie me sal merci ẏine
Alle daies o life mine
And ẏat i wun with mikel strenfh
In house of louerd in daies lengh

l.quote: Domini est terra et plenitudo [eius orbis terrarum et]

lg.l: Of Louerd his erẏe and fullhed hisse
Erẏeli werld and al ẏat ẏar in esse
For he him staẏeled on ẏe se
And on flodes him for ẏarked he
Who sal stigh in Louerdes hill to dred
Or who sal stand in his he sted
Vnderand of hend beden
And ẏat isse of hert klenne
In unnait whilk is saule noht name
Ne swore to his neghtbur swicdome
He sal tak of louerd blissinge
And merci of god his helinges
Tis is ẏe strend of him sekand
ẏe face of god iacob laitand
Open your yates with ẏour hand
ẏe ẏat are princes of ẏe lande
And yates in ai open be ẏe
And kinge of blisse income sal he
Who is he kinge of blisse Louerd strange
In mihtand in fight Louerd mihtand lange
Who is he kinge of blisse ẏat isse
Louerd omihtes he is kinge of blisse

l.quote: Ad te Domine levavi animam meam [; Deus meus]

lg.l: To ẏe Louerd mi saule houe I
Mi god in ẏe .i. I traiste me shame for ẏi
Ne scorne me sal mi fo
For ẏe vphald noht shent ben ẏo
Shente be al qued do and
Ouer com in ani land
Shew me Louerd ẏi waies þat be
And ẏi stiẏes lere ẏou me
In ẏi soghnes ẏou me right
And lere both dai and night
For mi beriẏer art tou ai
And ẏei vpheld al ẏe dai
Louerd of ẏi reuhnes min you mare
And of ẏi milẏes in werld ẏat are
Giltes of min ẏou ẏe in ẏhot
And min vnwittandes min ẏou noht
After ẏi merci min of me
you Louerd forgodnes of ẏe
Shew and right Louerd is ai
For þat sal he lagh gif to giltand in wai
Right handtam he sal in dome
And lere ẏe mild his waies to come
Alle waies of Louerd mils and soghnes
To sekand his witword and his witnes
For ẏi nam Louerd mils to me sinne
For mikel it is ẏat i am inne
Who is man dredes Louerd with outen lesse
Lagh set to him in wai he chese
His saule sal dwel in godes al
And his sede erẏe ere it sal
festnes is Louerd to him dredand so
And his witword þat be send to ẏo
Mine eyen ai to Louerd ẏai be
For mi fet of snar out sw sal he
Loke in me and of me haue merci
For on lic and pouer am .I. I
Manifold are in hert drouinges
Outtake me of mi nedinges
Se mi swink and mi mekensse
And forgif mi giltes more and lesse
Behald mi fos manifold are ẏai
/ wik hatreden ẏat hat me ai
ẏeme mi saul and outtak me
And sal noht shame for i hoped in ẏe
Vndrand and rightwise kleued to me
For ẏat i hupheld ẏe
Lese Louerd irael
Of al his drouinge ẏou mai wele

l.quote: Iudica me Domine quoniam [ego in innocentia mea]

lg.l: Deme me Louerd for i am gon
In mine vndrandes on on
And in Louerd hopand am I. I
I sal noht be vnfest for ẏi
LouErd fond me and fraist me with wo
Swiẏe mine eres mine hert als so
For befor mine eiyen ẏi merci esse
And quemed in ẏi sohtnes
I ne sal noht site with vnnayt rede
Ne i ne sal ingo with berand qwede
Kirk o liẏerand hated I
And with wic me sal noht site for ẏi
Mi hend bitwene vndrand wasse I sal
And vmgo Louerd ẏin weuede alle
ẏat I here steuen of lof ad telle
Alle ẏi woundres ẏat be felle
Louerd i loued farehed of ẏi hous isse
And sted of woninges of ẏi blisse
Lesse noht with wic god mi saule
With men of blodes mi lif als so
In whos hend his wickednes
ẏar righthand fild of giftes is
And in min vndrandnes gon am I
Bie me and of me haue mercy
Mi fote stode in rightynges to be
In kirkes blisse Louerd sal I ẏe
Mi lightynges Louerd mi help so rife
Whom sal .I. I dred whil þat qwak
Louerd forhiler of mi life
Whi is for whom I sal qwake
Whil neghen of me derand
Til ete mi flesshes ẏat are boune
Mi fos whilk me are drenand
ẏai are vnfest and fel a doune
If castels again me stand
yit sal mi hert haue no dred
If fiht again me be risand
In ẏat sal i hope for to spede
Of Louerd life asked .I. I
ẏat sal I seke to he me gife
In his hous to wun him bi
Waies al whilk ẏat I liue
ẏat .i I se ẏe wele in quert
Of Louerd is fader and sone
And ẏe kirke of with hert
Seke i ẏer mine forto wun
For in his teld hid he me
In ye sai of wicked blode
He wof me in hidel to me be
In his teld yat is so gode
Ston richest ẏat mai be
Heghed he me als he did oft
And nou mi heued heghed he
Ouer mi fos ful hegh of loft
I vmẏod and offred ai
In his teld of berand steuen
I singes sal and salme sai
vnto Louerd ẏat is [in] heuen
Here Louerd mi steuen qwen i cri oht
Haue merci of me ad here me
To ẏe mi hert said mi face ẏe soght
ẏi face Louerd sal i sek se
Ne turne noht ẏi face fro me
Ne bogh in wragh seruand ẏine
For sale noght mi helper be
Ne for sake me god of hele mine
For me fader mi moder me forsoke
And Louerd me kep als his willes was
Bete to me Louerd in ẏi wai
Right me in right stigh to mi force
Ne haue noght giuen me with ẏi wille
In saules ofe me drouand
For in me rose witnes ille
ẏar wicnes to ẏam is liẏand
Godes of Louerd ti se trou I
In ẏe erẏe of liuand nou
Abide Louerd and do manli
And ẏe be stired and Louerd vphald tou

l.quote: Ad te Domine clamabo Deus meus [ne sileas a]

lg.l: Louerd i sal cri to ẏe
Mi god ne stint noht fro me
Ne when lefe fro me in lande
And be lik in flosse falland

l.quote: [Exaudi Domine vocem deprecationis meae dum oro ad te]

lg.l: Here Louerd of mi besekinge steuen
Whil .i. I bidde to ẏe in heuen
Whil ẏat i heue hend mine
To kirke heli ẏat is ẏine
Ne samen giue me with sinnand
And ne lese me with wicnes wirkand
Whilk speken to ẏar neghtbur pais
And iueles in ẏar hertes saies
After ẏar werk giue to ẏo
After miht of ẏar findinges als so
After ẏar werk yeld to ẏo
yeld forẏeldinge of ẏo to ẏam so
For ẏat noht ẏai vnderstode
Werkes of Louerd ẏat are gode
For in ẏar hand werk ẏam fordo
ẏou salt and noht bige ẏar to

l.quote: [Benedictus Dominus quoniam exaudivit vocem deprecationis meae]

lg.l: Blisse Louerd for herd herd steuen
Of mi beseking in to heuen

l.quote: [Benedictus Dominus quoniam exaudivit vocem deprecationis meae]

lg.l: And blomed in flessh ouer al
And of mi wil shriue ot him i sal
Louerd strengh of his folk isse
And forhiler of fanninge of crist hisse
Beryed mak ẏou for to be
Folk ẏine Louerd ẏat leue in ẏe
And blisse ẏin eritage niht and dai
Stere ẏam and vpheue ẏam til in ai

l.quote: Afferte Domino filii dei [; afferte Domino filios arietum]

lg.l: Bringes to Louerd god sones to be
Sones to shep of louerd bringe ẏe
Bringes to Louerd wurship and blisse
Bringes to Louerd blisse to nome hisse
Biddes Louerd ai for ẏi
In his porche ẏat is heli
Steuen of Louerd in miht it isse
Steuen of Louerd in mikelnesse
Steuen of Louerd ẏat isse baulde
Ouer watres swiẏe kaulde
God of mikelhed ẏhunred he
Of watres felle yat be
Steuen of Louerd brekand cedres o none
And Louerd brek sal cedres of yban
And gnid als yban calfe he mune
And Louerd als vnicornes sone
Louerd steuen logh of fire of betwix balland
Louerd steuerd steuen wildernes frintand
And stere sal Louerd with his hand
Wildernes of cilde lande
Louerd steuen of graiẏand hertes hisse
And mi hile he sal wicnes
And in his temple yat isse heli
Als sal blisse sai for ẏi
Louerd flode in mas to wun
And sitte louerD kinge in euer he mune
Louerd miht to his folk sal giue
And his folk in pais to liue

l.quote: Exaltabo te Domine quoniam [suscepisti me ; nec dilectasti]

lg.l: For me kep Louerd .i. I sal upheue ẏe
Ne breddest mi fos ouer me
Louerd mi god to ẏe cried I
And tou held me for ẏi
Louerd ẏou led mi saule fro helle
ẏou sanned me fro ẏat in flosse felle
Singes Louerdes haliẏes with switnes
And shriues to mind of his helines
For wragh is in his mislikinges
And liue in his wille of al ẏinges
At heuen wepinges dwelle salle
And at morn fainnes alle
And in miht sumnes saide .I. I
I ne sal stire in ai for ẏi
Louerd mi god wille ẏine
ẏou lent me miht to fairhed mine
Fro me turned ẏi lickam
And to dreued mad am I
To ẏe Louerd cri I sal
And to mi god beseke with al
What noht fulnes is in mi blode
Whil i doun stihe in stink vngode
Nou what sal dust be streuen to ẏe
Or shew ẏi godenes what it be
Louerd herd and is rewand of me
Mi helper made Louerd is he
ẏou turned mi wepe and mi wo
In blisse to me for to go
you slittes mi seke in two
And umgaf me with fainnes so
ẏat ẏe singe mi blisse wele more
And noght sal .I. I be stungen sore
Louerd god mine yat ai sal be
In euer sal I shriue to ẏe

l.quote: In te Domine speravi non confundar [in eternum ; in iustitia tua libera me]

lg.l: In ẏe .i. I hope Louerd I ne sal shent be
In ai mi rightwisnes lese me
Boẏe ẏin ere and to me liẏe
ẏat tou me outta hiẏe swiẏe
To me in god forhiler be
And hous in fleinge ẏat tou saf me
For ẏou art mi strengh and hous in fleinges at nede
And for ẏi nam you sal me foster and fede
ẏou sal led me fro gilder þat to me ẏai hide
For mi forhiler ert tou kidd
In ẏi hind i giue mi gost to be
Louerd god of soghnes ẏou boght me
ẏou hated in ilka land
Fantomes houer to me hed rennad/reimand
Ssoghlic in louerd hoped I
I sal glad and faine in ẏi mercy
For he beheld mekenes mine
ẏou saned fro nedinges saul mine
Ne ẏou me be louked in hend of fo
In roum stede you sete mi fet to go
Louerd haue mercy of me
For droued am i. I forto be
To dreued is mi wragh for wo
Mine eye mi saule mi wombe als so
For wansed in forgh mi life
And mi yeres in sighinge es rife
Mi might in pouert is vnfest
And mi bones are dreued withoute rest
ouer al mi fos mad i am vpbraidinges
To mi neghtbur swiẏe and to mi couth dredinge
ẏo ẏat me segh eueriklon
Out fro me ẏai flegh onon
For i am giuen for mikel vnquert
To forgetelnes als ded fro hert
I am mad als lome lorn for i herd snibbinge
Of mani dwelland in vmgiuinge
In ẏat whil samen come again me
To take mi saul redi ẏai be

l.quote: [Ego autem in te speravi Domine dixit Deus meus]

lg.l: and in ẏe i hoped mi god artou said I
In ẏi hend lottes min for ẏi

l.quote: Eripe [me de manu inimicorum meorum et a persequentibus]

lg.l: Out take me fro hend of mi fo
And ẏat are filiand me fro ẏo
Light ẏi face ouer ẏi hine
And sauf me make for merci ẏine
Louerd fordone sal i noht be
For ẏat i in kald in ẏe
Shame mote wic and be led to helle
Dumbe be mad swikel lippes fell
Whilk speke to ward right wicked ẏinge
In pride and in outweringe
Hou mikel manihed of ẏi swetnes in land
Louerd ẏat ẏou hid to ẏe dredand
ẏou ful mad hopand in ẏe
In sight of sones of men to be
In hildede of ẏi face you salt am hide
Fro for drouinge of men beside
ẏou salt for hille am in ẏi teld stille
Fro againsayinges of ẏinges ille
Blissed Louerd for he selkouthed to me
Merci hisse in warnned citee
And i said in outganges of yhot mine
I am forkusten fro face of eyen ẏine
For ẏi herd bede of steuen of me
Whil ẏat i cried to ẏe
I ese halles al Louerd loue ẏe
For Louerd soghnes seke sal he
And ẏeld roumlic he sal with hand
To ẏo ẏat are pride doand
Dos manlic and ẏour hert streuied be
Alle whilk in Louerd hope ẏe

l.quote: Beati quorum remisse sunt iniqui[tates et quorum]

lg.l: Seli whilk forgiuen wickednesse
And whilk ẏar sinne forhiled it isse
Seli man to whome god wot no sinne
Ne in his gast swicdim ine
For i blan mi bones are elded ai
Whil ẏat i cried al ẏe dai
For ouer both dai and niht
Heuied is ẏi hand of miht
I am turned in mi sorgh ẏar forn
Whiles ẏat priked is ẏ[e] thorn
Mi gilt to ẏe sheued i mad
Min vnrihtwisnes and hid I ne hade
I said toward me sal i shriue
To louerd min vnrightwis liue
And tou forgaf ẏe more and lesse
Of mi sinne ẏe wickednesse
For yat sal bidde to ẏe with blisse
Al hale in tideful tim ẏat isse
Bot of watres in strang cominge
And to him sal ẏai negh no ẏinge
Mine in fleinge are tou to be
Of drouinge ẏat vmgaue me
Mi gladshit out tak me fro ẏo
ẏat me are vmgiuand me so
Vnderstandinge i gif ẏe sal
And i sal lere ẏe more with al
Gate whilk ẏou sal go min best
Mine eyen sal i on ẏe fest
Als hors or mule wil noht be
In whilk vnderstanding is non
I keuil and bridil ẏar checes straite
ẏat ẏe ne wil not neh hand laite
Mikel swinkinge ouer sinful cliues
Hopand in god merci vngiues

l.quote: Exultate iuste in Domino [rectos decet collaudatio]

lg.l: Glades riht wise in Louerd kinges
Rightwise feres to haue louyinge
To Louerd shriues in harp and santre
Of ten stringes to him sing ẏe
Singes to him neu sang and euen
Wele singes to him in berand steuen
For right is Louerd ai
And his werkes in treuye ar ẏai
For he loues dome in merci
Of Louerd merci ful erẏe is for ẏi
With worde of Louerd heuens fest are so
And gast of his mouth al miht of ẏo
Gederand als in lomes watrs of se
In hordes setand depnes to be
Alle erẏe Louerd be dredand
For of him is stred al werld erdand
For he said and ẏai made ware
He bade and tai shapen are
Louerd scateres redes of gomes mo
He shone ẏhotes of folk als so
And te redes shones he
Of alle ẏi princes ẏat mai be
And red of Louerd is with outen ende
In hertes ẏhot in strende and strende
Seli genge whilk louerd god his isse
Folk whilk [h]e ches him in eritage hisse
fro heuen be held Louerd ẏar he wones
He segh al mensones
Fro graiẏed teld his on hegh
Ouer ẏat erden erẏe he segh
Whilk fried sunderlic hertes of ẏo
Wilk vnder standes al ẏar werkes so
ẏe king noht sauf sal be right
ẏing out nokin mikel miht
And tou eten noht be sal
In mikelhed of his miht al
Les hores til hele of miht sumnes
Soghlic of his miht nou sanned ise
Loke eyen of Louerd of him dredand
Hand in ẏo on his merci whilk ar hopand
ẏat ẏar saules dede he tak fro
And in hunger foster ẏo
ouer saul Louerd vphald sal
For he is helper and our forhiler al
For faine sal our hert in him to be
And in his heli name hoped we
Thi merci be ouer us
So als we hoped in ẏe ẏus

l.quote: Benedicam Dominum in omni [tempore semper laus]

lg.l: In al time Louerd sal i blisse
Ai in mough mine louing hisse
In Louerd mi saul sal loued be ai
Here and ẏan faine and glade inot/mot ẏai
Mikel ẏe Louerd with me
And his nam in himselue vpheue we
I soht Louerd and me herd he
And al in drouinges tok he me
Neghes to him and ẏe be liyinges sone
ẏour face sal noht be fordone
ẏis pouer cried Louerd herd him
And of al his drouinges he sauued him
He send Louerdes aungel in vmganges
He outtok ẏo wore him dredand
Dredes Louerd al halẏes hisse
For dred and him not helples isse
Swohes and ses so soft Louerd isse
Selli man whilk hopes in him for blisse
Dredes Louerd al halẏes hisse
For dred and him no writchedhed isse
riche of aght ẏat wore
ẏai neded and hungred sore
And sekand Louerd after fode
Noght sal be lessed of al gode
Comes sones me ẏe here
And dred of Louerd I sal ẏou lere
Who is man ẏat o liue wil be
Loues goddes daies forto se
For were ẏi tunge fro iuel ai
ẏi lippes swicdom ẏat noht spek ẏai
do gode and turne fro iuel and sinne
Sseke paies and filie to wune ẏar inne
Ouer rightwise Louerdes eyen two
And his eres in bedes of ẏo
Ai ouer il doand Louerdes lickam
ẏat he lese fro erẏe mind of ẏam
Rightwise cried Louerd herd ẏar wo
And al ẏar drouinges lesed he ẏo
Ne is Louerd to droued of hert
And soft heles in qwert
Mani drouinges of rightwise
And Louerd ẏam lesed of al ẏis
Alle ẏar bones Louerd ẏeme so
Noht sal be broken on of ẏo
Dede of sinful werst it isse
And ẏat haten rightwise giltnesse
Bie Louerd sal saules of his hine ai
And alle in him hope noht gilt sal ẏai

l.quote: Iudica Domine innocentes [me expugna expugnantes me]

lg.l: Deme louErd me derand
Ouer ẏraw in ne fheghtand
Gripe wepenes and sheld to ẏe
And vprise in help to me
ẏatte swerd ẏat me filie again louk y()am
Sai to me saule ẏi hele .I. I am
ya[i] befordone and shent be ẏo
Ssekand saule mine to slo
Turne mote hindward and fordon be
ẏinkand iueles vnto me
ẏai be als dust befor windes lickam
And Louerdes aungel narwand ẏam
Mirke and sliper mad be ẏar wai
And Louerdes aungel filiand am ay
For willi to me hid ẏo
Sterninges of ẏar gilder so
Ouer empti vpbraided ẏai
Saul mine be niht and dai
Come to him snar whilk nis him? kid
And ẏe takynges whilk he hid
Gripe mot it him self with al
And in snare in him selue he falle
And mi saule to Louerd glad sal
And like ouer his hele with al
Alle min sai sal ẏai
Louerd to ẏe who like be mai
Lesand helples of his strange hand
Nedful and pouer fro him robband
Risand witnes wik wore ai
ẏat i ne wiste me asked ẏai
Iueles for godes ẏeld ẏai to me
Leighed to mi saul to be
I sohlic wille to me ẏai wore
Hackand haire kled .i. I ẏore
I meked in fastinge saul of me
Mi bede in mi bosum I turned to be
Also neghtbur als broẏer your als so
Als qwemed I vnto ẏo
Als wepand and sammen mornand
So i meked ẏur ẏe lande
Toward me ẏai fained and to me onon
ẏai samned on me sweping and wist none
ẏai are scatred ne stungen sore
ẏai fraisted me ẏe lesse and more
Wiht sneringe me ẏa snered so
With ẏar tegh bot gnaist and on me ẏo
Louerd when ẏou be hal sal
Again set tou mi saule sal
Fro ye liẏernes of ẏho
Fro lions mensones als so
In mikel kirke sal i to ẏe shriue
In hel folk loue ẏe mi liue
Noht ouer glade sal ẏai be
Whilk wiẏerward wich to me
ẏat wisefulli me haten ai
And ẏar ẏhien becke ẏai
For ẏat sinne/sume to me wore
Paisfulli ẏat speken ẏore
And in wraghed of erẏe spekand
Swicdomes wore ẏai ẏinkand
And tei bred ẏare mough ouer me
And said wo wo our eyen se
ẏou segh Louerd noht blinne ẏou
Ne wite ẏou noht fro me nou
Rise behald to dome mine
God min and Louerd min in skille mine
Deme after ẏi rightwisnes
Louerd ẏat ai god min isse
And noht if ẏat ẏi wil be
Ouer mirgh ẏai open me
Noght sai in ẏar hertes wo wo be
To our saul ne ẏai sai him swolie sal we
ẏai shamed and shent samen be ẏai
Whilk samen of min iueles ay
In shenship and shennes cled be ẏo
ẏat leẏernes speken opon me so
Glade and saine mote more and lesse
Whilk ẏat whille mi rightwisnes
And mikelhed be Louerd ai sai ẏai
ẏat pais to his hine wil ai
And be ẏinc sal tunge mine
ẏi rightwisnes al dai of ẏine

l.quote: Dixit iniustus ut non [delinquat in semet ipso]

lg.l: Said mi rightwis in him þat he ne gilt mis
Goddes dred befor his eyen noht isse
For in his sight swiclic did he
ẏat his wicnes to hatereden funded be
Wordes of his mouth ẏat go
Wickednes swicdom als so
He ne wald noht vnderstand
ẏat he did wele with hert ne hand
Wickednes has he ẏhot ai
In his leẏhe ẏare he lai
be stode als stret noht god ẏat be
And iuelnes noht hated he
Louerd in heuen ẏi merci isse
And to cloudes ẏi sohnes
Als hilles of god ẏi rightwisnes
ẏin domes mikel depnes
Men and mares Louerd sauf ẏou sal
And tou manifolded god ẏi merci al
Mennesones soghlic in helinge ai
Of ẏin wenges hop sal ẏai
ẏai be drunken als of wine
Of ẏe fulhed of hous ẏine
And of brunnand of ẏi liking so
Ale sal tou giue drinc to ẏo
For welle of lif it is at ẏe
And ẏi light light sal we se
Spred ẏi merci to witand ẏi quert
And ẏi rightwisnes to right of hert
Noht come to me force of pride
Ne sinful hand me stired be side
ẏor felle tai wicnes are wirkand
ẏai are out put ne ẏai miht stand
Ne wil you miht in liẏerand
Ne loue ẏat wicnes wirkand
For als hai swiẏe drie sal yai alle
And als blade of gresse tite mun ẏai fal
Hope in Louerd and de godnesse
And bigge ẏerẏe and best fed in his riches
Like in Louerd and he sal ẏe giue
ẏine hert askinges whilk ẏou mai liue
Unhile to Louerd ẏi wai al
Hope in him and do he sal
And rightwisnes he sal led als light
And ti dome als mi dai bright
vnderlout to Louerd tou be
And bid him for best is he
Ne wil noht filie in him ai
ẏat is smertful in his wai
Ne in man yat liuand isse
ẏat is doand vnrightwisnesse
Blin fro bragh and leue wragh swiẏe
ẏat ẏou ne be liẏered wil noht in ẏe
For ẏat liẏeren outend sal ai
And filiand god bige ẏe erẏe sal ẏa
And yite a litel ẏe be se
And sinful ne sal noht be
And tou sal sek his sted of wun
And neuer find ẏou ne munne
And sof sal big erẏe ẏat isse
And like of pais in mikelnesse
Behald rightwise sal sinful ẏenne
And with his tegh sal on him grenne
And Louerd sal scorn him ai
For he lokes ẏat come sal his dai
Swerd vnsheyed sine/sinNe doand
ẏar bou ẏai bended with ẏar han[d]
Pouer and helples ẏat ẏai be swike
And whel in rightwise of hert ilike
ẏar swerdes mote in ẏar hertes go
And ẏar ba[u]t be broken in two
Better is litel to right with wele
Ouer riches of sinful fele
For sinful armes broken ben ẏai
Louerd rightwise he festnes ai
Louerd knaues daies of unwemmed mo
And eritage in ai sal be of ẏo
ẏai sal noht be fordone of blisse
In no time ẏat iuel isse
And in daies of hunger ẏai sal be filt
When sinful be forbone and spilt
For godes wiẏerwines al be dene
Sswiẏe when ẏai smensked bene
And ẏat ẏai are heghed oght
Wansand als reke ẏa wanes to noght
Sinful sal borẏe and yeld he ne sal
Rightwise sal mils again yeld al
For big sal erẏe are him blissand
And for wurẏe sal him weriand
At Louerd goinges of men are ay
Righted and will his wai
When rightwise falles hortes no lim
For Louerd has set his hand on him
I was yunges I elded sone
I ne saw neuer rightwise fordon
Ne ẏe sede of him comand
ẏat it was bred oght sekand
Al dai he redes and leues his yinge
And his sedes sal be in blissinge
Bogh fro iuel and do god ai
And erẏe in werld of werld ẏou mai
For god dome loues noht let sal he
His halẏes in ai sal ẏemed be
Unrightwise sal pained sonne
Annd sede of wicked be fordone
And are ẏe erẏe ẏai mune
In werld of werld ẏer min to wun
Mouthe of rightwise sal spek wisdum
And dome sal ẏink ẏe tung of ẏam
Godes lagh in hert is o non
And his sal noght be undergone
Sinful be haldes ye rightwise
And sekes to slo him on al wise
And Louerd noht forlet sal he
Him in his hend to be
Ne Louerd ouer him sal he noht
When he is demde til him for oht
Abide louerd and ẏeme his wai
And him self sal heghe ẏe ai
ẏat in eritage ẏou take lande to ẏe
When sinful lorn be ẏou mun se
Vphouen .i. I segh ye wicked man
And lifted als cedres of yban
And ferd and loke he was to misse
And soght noht funden is stede hisse
yeme vndrandnes and se euennesse
For are relikes to man paisful isse
In unrightwise samen ben fordon
And relikes of wic forwurth sal son
And hele of rightwise fro Louerd fulwide
And ẏar forhiler in drouinge tide
And Louerd help sal he ẏo
And he sal lese ẏam fro wo
And fro sinful out ẏam nime
And sauf ẏam for ẏai hoped in him

l.quote: Domine ne in furore tuo [arguas me neque]

lg.l: Louerd ẏrahe me noht in bragh
Ne ouernim me in ẏi wragh
For ẏin arwes in stiked are to me
And on me ẏou fest ẏe hand of ẏe
Noght is heli in flesse mine
Fro ẏe face of wragh ẏine
Ne pais in mi bones god
For ẏe lickam of mi fos
For mi fos euer ilkon
Mi heued are ẏai ouergone
Als heui birẏin mai am be
Are ẏai hemed ouer me
Min ille eres stanc and broken are ẏai
Fro face of mine vnuisdome ai
Wreched man maked am .i. I
And broked i am til en for ẏi
Alle ẏe dai for mikel wo
Samen murnand in I go
For mi lunges filt with heyinges are ilkon
And in flesse mine hele is none
I am meked swiye and swungen smert
I swed fro sighinge of mi hert
Mi miht for let me for unqwert
And light of min eyen two
And nis noht with me so
Mine neghbures and mi frendes gode
Toward me neghed and stode
And ẏat bi me wore ẏai stod on lengh
And ẏat iules to me soght fantomn spak ẏai
and swicdomes ẏhot ẏai al ẏe dai
Sothlic als def here .I. I na more
And als doumbe be his mough noht opened wore
And i am mad als man noht herand
And store speche in his mouh noht hauand
And for ẏat in ẏe hoped I
Mi Louerd mi lo? god here me for ẏi
For .i. I said lese when ẏat mo
OuEr mirẏe to me mi fo
And whilk fete mine stired wore
Ouer me gret ẏinhge spak ẏai ẏore
For in swepinges am .I. I dight
And mi sorou ai in mi sight
For mi wickednes shew sal i al
And for mi sinne ẏink i sal
Mi fos soghlic liuand be
And festened are ẏai ouer me
And manifolded are ẏai ẏo
Whilk wicked me hated so
ẏat yelden iueles for godes for ẏi
Bacbot me for godnes filied I
Louerd god mine ne forlet me
Ne wite fro me whore i be
Behald in mi help nou
Louerd god of mi hele art tou

l.quote: Dixit custodiam vias meas [ut non delinquam]

lg.l: I said mi waies yhem i sal
Mi tung ẏat in gilt with al
i set yeming to mi mough to be
When sinful stode againes me
I dumbed and i am meked and i was stille
Fr godes and mi sorgh is neued ille
Mi hert het withine me so
And in mi ẏhot brend fire for wo
I spak with mi tung in mi mough
Min ending Louerd mak to me kouth
And tale of mi daies whilk is to se
ẏat i wit what wantes me
Loke moten ẏou set min daies to be
And mi staẏelnes als noht be for ẏe
Sohlic al fantum here in lande
Ilka man ẏat is liuand
soghlic in licnes ẏhurefare man
Bote and idel is he dreued onan
He hordes and he wote noht
To whom ẏat he sal samen oht
And nou mi bidding whilk mai be
Soghlic Louerd mi sped is at t[h]e
Of mi wicnesse outtak me nou
vpbraiding til vnwise me gaf ẏou
.i. I doumbed and noht upheued mough mine
ẏat ẏou mad stire fro wundes ẏine
Of strengh of ẏi hand witerli
In snibbinges wansid .i. I
For wicnesse and mikel sinne
Ouerẏrou ẏou manes kinne
And sculk als irain ẏou mad saule his
Soghlic idel dreued ilka man isse
Here mi bed Louerd and beseking mine
Mi teres be se with eres ẏine
Ne blinne for comeling .i. I am to ẏe
And pilgrim als all mi fadres be
Gainsend me ẏat cold i be al
Ere i go and no mor i sal
Abidand Louerd abode .I. I
And he behelde to me for ẏi
ẏe herd mi bede and lede me ẏen
Of wreched slogh of dret of fen
And he set mi fet on ston
And right mi goinges onon
And he insend in mough new song
Loftsong til our god and long
Se sal fele and dred ẏai sal
[h]and hope in Louerd sal ẏai al
Seli man of whom ẏat isse
Name of Louerd hope ai hisse
And lokes in fantomes alle
Ne in wodenes ẏat are false
Mani ẏinges mad tou for to be
Louerd mi god wundre of ẏe
And with ẏin ẏhotes ẏat are slike
Is non ẏat mai be to ẏe like
I shewed and i spake ai
Ouer tale manifolded ar ẏai
Offrand and ouelotes wald tou noht se
Eres soghlic mad tou to me
Offrand for sinne none asked tou
ẏen saide .I. I lok i come nou
In heuen of bok is writen of me
ẏat i suld do ẏe wille of ẏe
God mine i wald in qwert
And t[h]i lagh in mid mi hert
I shewed ẏi rightwisnes
In ẏe kirke ẏat mikel isse
Loke mi lippes noht forbede sal .I. I
Louerd ẏou wost witerli
ẏi rightwisnes in hert i hid
ẏi soẏenes and t[h]i hele i bide
I ne hidd ẏi merci ne ẏi soẏenes
For no red ẏat mikel esse
And tou Louerd noght fer make ẏi rewẏes of me
ẏi soẏenes and t[h]i merci ai fong me
For umgaf me iuels so
Of whilk no tale is of ẏo
Mi wicnesse vMlapped me [n]egh
And i ne might noght þat i segh
Manifolded ouer hore of mi heued are ẏai
And mi hert forsoke me ai
Qwem to ẏe Louerd þat ẏou outtak me
Louerd at help me loke and se
Shent and fordone be ẏai
ẏat seke to bere mi saule owai
ẏai wende obac and shent tai be
ẏat seken iuels vnto me
Radlic shens[h]ip bere ẏa ẏo
ẏat saine to me wo wo
ẏai glade and faine ouer ẏe ai
Alle ẏat ẏe seke niht and dai
And saine ai Louerd mikelhed be
Whilk ẏat loue ẏe hele of ẏe
And pouer and ẏi[n]ggand am .I. I
Louerd winsum is to me for ẏi
Mi helper and forhiler ar tou
Mi god ne late noht nou

l.quote: Beatus qui intellegit [super egenum et pauperem]

lg.l: Seli whilk wil vnderstand
Ouer nedful and pouer in land
In iuel dai fro wicnesse alle
Louerd lese him seke and qUIken him so
And make him seli in erẏe to go
And noght gif him forto wende
In saule of his iuil frende
Louerd help sal bring to him with wine
Ouer bede of his sorgh ẏat he lis inne
Al ẏe strale of him ẏat is
Turned tou in his sekenesse
I said Louerd haue merci of me
Hele mi saule for i sinned to ẏe
Min fos iuels saiden to me ẏisse
When sal he deie and forwurẏe nam hisse
And if he inihed þat he segh
vnnaitnes spak he on hegh
Hert of him it samned so
Wickedness to him and wo
He out yede out held him to be
And in himseluen spake he
Again me toteled al mi fos stille
Again me ẏhot tai to me ille
Wic word ẏai set againes me
Whilk slepes noht eke sal þat rise sal he
Soghlic man was of pais mine
In ẏe whilc i hoped ine
ẏat mi loues best [m]iht be
vndergoing mikelhed ouer me
And tou Louerd miles of me so
And raise me and i sal yeld to ẏo
In ẏat kneu i. I ẏat tou wald me
For noht mirẏe mi fo sal ouer me
And me for undrandnes kep ẏou riht
And fest me in ai in ẏi sight
Louerd of irael blissed be he
For in werld and in wer[l]d so be so be

l.quote: Quem ad modum desiderat [cervus ad fontes]

lg.l: Als hertes at well w[a]tres yorneSto be
So yornes mi saule god to ẏe
mi saul ẏristed withinne me
To god qwic wele ẏat ai is he
When i sal come swilc als .i. I am
And shew befor godes lickam
To me teres mine war ai
Loues boẏe niht and dai
Whil ilka dai i saide to me
Whore is to god what is he
ẏis mined i ful witerli
And in me i yhet mi saul for ẏi
For i sal fare in swouẏe [selcouth] sted of telde
vnto godes hous to welde
In steuen of glading and miriande
And of ẏris din of etand
Werfore mi saule murnes toou
And whi to dreues me nou
Hop in god for yit sal i to him shriue
Hele of mi face and mi god o liue
To mi selue mi saule is dreued sore
For ẏi sal .i. I min of ẏe more
Of land of iordan so i uille
And hermon fro ẏe litel hille
Depnes depnes incalles heuen
Of ẏin tokenynges in ẏe steuen
ẏin heghnesses and flodes of ẏe se
Alle ẏai ferden ouer me
In dai Louerd send his merci
And be niht his song for ẏi
At me [be]de to gode of mi lif al
Mo fonger are tou god sai i sal
Qwerfor if wil be
Haues tou forgeten me
And wherfor mourned inne i go
Whil ẏat twinges me ẏe fo
Whilk bones min are broken upbraid me so
Whilk ẏat drouen me mi fo
Whilk þat saien to me be daies alle
Whore is ti god ẏat men call
Wherfor mi saule mourned ar tou
And whi to dreus tou me nou
Hope in god for ẏit sal i to him shriue
Hele mi face mi god oliue

l.quote: Iudica me Deus et discerne [causam meam de gente]

lg.l: Deme god and shed mi skille
Fro folc ẏat noht ben heli wille
Fro man wicked ẏat ai wil be
And swikeful outtak ẏou me
For (ya)t god mi strengh ar tou
Whi awai droue ẏou me nou
And warfor morned in i go
Whil ẏat twinges me ẏe fo
Outsend ẏi light þat is so bright
And ti sothnes ful of [m]ight
And tai me fro lede and led me til
In ẏi heli teld and heli hille
And to god unwemmed in go .i. I sal
To god mi youẏe ẏat faines al
To ẏe in harp sal i shriue
God mi god ẏat is oliue
Wharfor murned mi saule ar tou
And whi to dreues tou me nou
Hope in god for yit to him .i. I shriue
Hele of mi face and mi god alle

l.quote: Deus auribus nostris audivimus [patres nostri adnuntiaverunt]

lg.l: God with our eres
Our fadres shewed til vs
Werk in ẏar daies ẏou wrought
In ould daies ẏat ẏou are noht
ẏi hand spred folk and tou had ẏo
ẏou twinged folk and outdrof am so
Ne in swerd land haue ẏai sal
and ẏar arme sal noght sauue all
Bot ẏi right hand and tin arm and of ẏi lickam
Lighting for ẏou quemed in ẏam
ẏou ert he mi god and mi king
ẏa sendes to god heling
In ẏe our fos blow with horn sal we
And forgiue in us risand in name of ẏe
Noght in bogh sal i hope alle
And mi swerd noht sauue me sal
For ẏou sauued us fro us thiwrghand
And tou foryet are us hatand
In gode al we be loued al dai
And in ẏi name be shriuen in werld for ai

l.quote: [Nunc autem reppulisti et confudisti nos et non egredieris in virtutibus nostris]

lg.l: Bot nou ẏou outdroue and yet us so
And in our ẏhewes go[d] noh[t] sal noht outgo
ẏou turned us hindward after our fo
And ẏat us hated reued ẏo
ẏou gaf als shepe of mete we wore
And in genges tospredest us ẏore
ẏou solde ẏi folk withouten derwur[y]ing
And ẏar was noht hid mikel [mikelhid] in ẏar manging

l.quote: Posu[isti nos obprobrium vicinis nostris subsannationem et derisum qui in circuitu nostro]

lg.l: ẏou set us vpbraiding wide
Til our neghtbures vs beside
Suerring and heẏing ful lang
To ẏo ẏat are in our umgang
ẏou set us in licnes to genge so
Stiring of heued in folkes mo
Mi shame again me is al dai
And shenship of mi face ouerhiled me ai
Fro steuen vpbraidand and forspekand
Fro face of fo and of filiand
Alle ẏese come ouer us ai
Ne [we] forgat to niht ne dai
And wickedlic ne did we noht
In ẏi witworde with wil ne ẏhot
And againe [h]inwarrd our hert ẏode
And fro our wai ẏou yheld ẏi sties gode
For ẏou meked vs in twing stede
And helded ouer vs shadw of ded
If we forgete nam of our god we kend
And if til ou[t]e[n] god w[e]spred our hende
Noght ne sekes god ẏese to se
For hidinges of hert wele knaues he
For al dai dedelic we are for ẏe
Als shipe of [s]laghter trowed are we
Ris up Louerd whi slepes tou
Rise ne in ende againe put me nou
Whi tornes tou ẏi lickam so
Forgetest our drouing and our wo
For meked is in dust our saule fro blisse
Swolied in erthe our wombe isse
Rise up louerd help us for ẏi
And bie us for ẏi name heli

l.quote: Eructavit cor meum verbum [bonum dico ego]

lg.l: Mi hert refted god word ẏurgh me
I tel ẏe king werk of mi hand
Mi ting mod rede pipe maister be
Writer of swiftli writand
Fairest of shapp for be al
Of sones of men ẏat euer war born
Hap wald in ẏi lippes falle
God in ai has blissed ẏe ẏerforn
Girde ẏi swerd ouer ẏi ẏhe
MihtiLi ẏi sharpest men ẏe bring
For brightnes and fairhed of ẏe
Ta[ke]kep smert go forgh be king
Sohnes and softnes for ẏi
And rightwisnes ẏat in ẏe isse
It hit sal led te selkouthli
ẏi righthand into mikel blisse
ẏin arwes are ful sharp and boun
Folk whider-so ẏou gos
vnder ẏe sal ẏai doun
In hertes of ẏe kinges fos
ẏi setel Louerd is ful hegh in heght
In werld of werld and ai ilike
ẏe yerd of rightyng is right
yerd of ẏine awen rike
ẏou has ai loued rightwisnes
And hated wickednes ẏin yeres
For wight smerreles of fainnesse
ẏou smered ẏi god for be ẏi feres
Mir drop and bike more
Of ẏi cleẏing of bigginges
In ẏi rede of whilk ẏe yorned sore
In ẏi worship doghtres of kinges
ẏ[e] quene stode on ẏi righthand
In kleẏing gilt ẏat fairest isse
Is non swilke in al ẏe lande
vmgiuen al-with selkouthnesse
Herke nou doghter and se
Boẏe ere and to me here
Forget ẏi folk what so ẏai be
ẏi fader hous ẏat is te dere
And ti fairhed sal yorn ẏe king
For is Louerd ẏi god ouer alle
And til him for be al ẏing
Sal ẏai bidde bothe gret and smale
And te doghtres of tiri
In giftes ẏi faire face
Sal ẏai yorn ful inwardli
Richest of folk þat most gof has
Kinges doghtres al his blisse
Als he wil in so he bringes
In gilt hemminges als is hisse
vplapped al with selkouth ẏinges
Led are befor ẏe kinges kne
After hir maidens ful swete
Hes neghtburs ẏor ẏen walkd he be
To ẏe with godenes for to grete
For ẏi fadres are ẏe borne
ẏou salt am prince set ẏerforne
On ẏe land apon ẏe felde
ẏi name Louerd sal min ẏar liue
In geting and geting of strende
For ẏi ẏe folk sal to ẏe shriue
In werld of werld witouten ende

l.quote: Deus noster refugium et virtus [adiutor in tribulationibus]

lg.l: God our infleing and miht ẏus
Helper in drouinges whilk swiẏe com vs
For ẏi sal we noht dred whil erẏe dreued be
And hilles be born in hert of ẏe se
ẏai dinde and dreued ẏ[a]r watres ar so
To dreued ar hilles in strengh of ẏo
Stigh flodes coming fained godes cite
He halied his teld heghist mai be
God in mid it noht stire sal
God erli in griking help it sal al
Dreued are genges and helded rikes are
He gaues his steuen ẏe erẏe stired is ẏare
Louerd of ẏhewes with in blisse
Our fonger god ouer iacob isse
Comes goddes werkes to se
Tokenninges ouer erẏe whilk set he
Awai berand fightes towende
Out vnto ẏe erẏes ende
He sal [b]rise boye brek wopens in two
And sheldes brin with fire als so
Emties and ses witerli
ẏat i god am onli
Be houen in geniges sal i be mo
In erẏe i sal be houen als so
Louerd ẏhewes with us be
God of iacob our fonger is he
Al geinge plais with hend til heuen
Miries to god in gladeful steuen
For Louerd hegh aghful to se
Mikel god ouer am erẏe is he
He underkest folkes til us mo
Genge under our fet als so
Eritage til us he ches to be
Fairhed of iacob whilk loued he
Vpstegh god in mirth ful [euen]
And Louerd o[f] trump in steuen
Ssalmes til our god salme ẏe
Salmes til our king salme ẏe
For king of alle erẏe witerli
Is gode singes wiseli
Ouer alle genges gid sal rike
Godes sites on his heli sete ilike
prince of folkes haues samned ẏam
With ẏe god [y] of habraham
For ẏat godes of erẏe strang
Swiẏe vphouen are amang

l.quote: Magnus Dominus et laudabilis [nimis in civitate]

lg.l: Mikel and swiẏe louelic Louerd isse
In cite of our god in hille heli hisse
Grounded with gladnes be o[n]on
Alle erẏes hille of syon
Sides of north als so be
Of gret king ẏat isse cite
God be knawen in houses hisse
When he has fonged with blisse
For loke kinges ẏat most mai
Samned are in one come ẏai
Forwundred are ẏai seand so
ẏai are dreued ẏai are stire[d] quaking gripsan ẏo
Sors manifold are ẏore
Of kineland als if it wore
In strang gost sal tou b[e]rise am al
Shippes out of thares we calle
Als we heren als we se
Of Louerd of mihtes in cite
In cite of our god is he
God grounded it mai to be
We onfonged god ẏi merci
In mid ẏi kirk ful inwardli
Of rightwisnes is ẏi righthand
Faines syon hille and glade doghtres of iude
Louerd for domes of ẏe
Vmgos syon and clippes it
Telles in his toures yit
Settes your hertes ẏAr amang
In his mightes ẏat are strang
And deles his houses ẏer ẏe wende
ẏat ẏe telle in oẏer strend
For he es god our god in ai and alle
And in werld of werld he stiren sal

l.quote: Audite hec omnes gentes [auribus peripite omnes qui]

lg.l: Heres ẏis al genges with eres bese
ẏat bigge ẏe werld in to be
And whilke freli mensones ilk-on
Pouer and riche samen ilk-on
Mi mpouth sal speke wisdom on heght
And mi hert sal ẏik sleht
I sal bou min ere in forbisening
I sal open in sautre mi forsetting
Whi sal i dred in wic dai alle
Wicnes of mi helespur umgiue me sal
Whilk traist in ẏar miht and in mikelnesse
Blisse maken of ẏAr rightwisnesse
Broẏer sal noht bie man sal bie al
And noht giue his queming to god he sal
And wurth of b[i]ing to is sal towende
And swink he sal in ai and liue in ende
Noght in ende steruing ne sal he se
When beses unwise ẏat be
Deeand samen ẏe vnwise boẏe ẏo
And to fole forwrie ẏat be
And forlete til outen ẏar wil sal ẏai
And ẏar ẏrugh ẏar hous sal be in ai
In kind and kind teldes of ẏo
In ẏar land ẏai cald ẏar names so
Adn man in mensk when he was broght
He ne vnderstode it noght
Til vnwise mares mad euen is he
And maked til am like to be
ẏis ẏar wai sham til am al
And after ẏat in ẏar mouth queme ẏai sal
In helle als ship set be ẏai so
Ded fede sal al ẏo
And Louerd sal ouer ẏam for ẏi
Rightwise in morn erli
And to help of ẏam ẏat isse`
Sal eld in hel for ẏar blisse
Wheẏer mi saule god bie sal he
Fro helle and wen he has fonged me
Dred noht when man riche made isse
and when manifolded of his hous isse
For when he sterues noght in sal he al
Ne blisse of his houen with him sal fal
For his saule in his liue sal blissed be
ẏou sal blisse him when he shriues to ẏe
Til in kind of his fader income sal he
And til dai light noght sal he se
Man in mensk when he was broht
He ne vnderstode it noht
Til vnwise mares made euen is he
And maked til ẏam like to be

l.quote: Deus deorum [Dominus] locutus est [et vocavit terram]

lg.l: God of godes ai Louerd wille be
He spake and ẏe erẏe cald he
Fro sune risinges to going doune
Swetnes of fairhed of syon
God openli come he sal
Our god and noht [blinne] wi[t]h al
Fire in his sight sal brinne for ẏi
And in his vmgang sttorme wurẏi
Fro aboun cald he heuens of blisse
And ẏe erẏe to s[h]ede folk hisse
Degres his haliyes til his hand
ẏat welesettes his witteword ouer offrand
And sh[eu] al heuens his rightwisnes
Here to me mi folke sume-del
And i sal spek til irael
And i witnes to ẏe witerli
God ẏi gid ẏat am .I. I
I ne sal in offrandes ẏrep ẏe
For ẏin offrandes in mi sight ai be
Of ẏi hous calues nim sal .i. I non
Ne of ẏi foldes buckes neuer one
For al bestes of wode mine ar ẏo
Mares in hilles and nete als so
Al fliht-fouel of heuen i knew to se
and fairhed of feld it is with me
If me hunger me sal sai ẏe ẏis
For werld of erẏe mine is and fill[h]id is
Nou what sal [ .i. I ] ete bulles flesse
Or drink vlod of buckes nesse
Offre offrand and loue to god of blisse
And yeld til heghist hote hisse
And in dai o[f] drouing cal ẏou me
and tou sal me sensk i sal outtak ẏe
To sinful dog said nou
Mi rughtwisnes telles tou
And tou takes be ẏi mough
Mi witword ẏat is so kouth
ẏou soẏelic hated lore fulfast
And mi sayes hindward ẏo kast
If ẏou sagh ẏeef ẏou with him ran
And ẏou set ẏi dele with spousbrek man
ẏi mouth mihtsomed hiuel-hed among
And ti tung swicdomes it song
Sittand againe ẏi bruẏer with min
ẏou spak and again ẏi moder sune
Set tou shame ful inwardli
ẏise did tou and yit blan I
ẏou wendest wickedli with al
Like to ẏe ẏat be i sal
I sal ẏrep ẏe and set
Againe ẏi lickam sal i yete
Vnderstandes ẏese i ẏhote
ẏe whilk god forgettes oht
Lesewhenne ẏat robe he
And whilk outtakes hit non be
Offrand ẏat is of louing
Sal mensk me for am ẏing
and tar wai whilk shew him sal .I. I
Hele of god is witerli

l.quote: Miserere mei Deus secundum [magnam misericordiam tuam]

lg.l: God tou haue merci of me
After mikel merci of ẏe
and after of ẏi rewyes ẏe mikelnesse
Do awai mi wickednesse
non-more me wasse of min iuels beden
And of mi sinne ẏou klens me klen
For min iuel i knaw ẏat i am inne
And ai again me is mi sinne
To ẏe one sinned .i. I
Befor ẏe iuel i did for ẏi
ẏat in ẏi sayes ẏou be rightwise
And ouercome when ẏou demes his
Lok i am onfonged in iueles and wo
And in [sinne] me onfonged mi moder als so
Loke ẏou loued both dai and niht
Rigthwisnes for al ẏi miht
Unsiker and derne of ẏi wisdome
ẏou did me forto wite o[f] ẏome
Louerd ẏou sal strinkel me beden
ẏou ẏselue sal wasse me
And ouer snaw sal .i. I whitned be
To mi hering sal tou giue
Blisse and faines whil i liue
And for ẏi ẏai sal be glade
ẏe meked bones ẏat tou made
ẏi face fro mi sinnes torn ẏou ai
And al mi wicnesse fo awai
Klen hert make in me god and trew
and right gast in mi guttes new
Ne werp me noht fro face of ẏe
Ne ẏi heli gast bere noht fro me
yelde me of ẏi hele fainnes
And of heghest gast me fest ẏat isse
ẏi waies wicked sal i kenne
And quedes torne to ẏe sal ẏenne
Lese me fro blodes god of mi hele isse
And mi tung sal i glad in ẏi rightwisnes
Louerd ẏou sal open lippes mine
And mi mough shew sal louing ẏine
For if ẏou wald offrand had .i. I broht
For soght til offrand lustes tou noht
Offrand make ẏou on hast
To god ẏat art droued gast
Hert frobroken and meked ẏhot
God forsake ne sal tou noght
Willi Louerd make and noht ille
To syon in ẏi god wille
and biged beine ẏai þat men calles
Of ierusalem ẏe walles
ẏen sal tou take with ẏi hand
Rightwise offrand ẏhurgh ẏe land
Ouelotes and offrandes on al halues
ẏen sal ẏa set ouer weued ẏin calues

l.quote: Quid gloriaris in malita [qui potens est iniquitate]

lg.l: Whi mas tou blisse in iuelnesse
Whilk mihtand art in wickednesse
Vnrightwisnes ẏhot ẏi tung al dai
Als sharp rasur swicdom did ẏou ai
ẏou loued iuelnesse ouer bitternesse
More to spek wicnesse and euennesse
ẏou loued al wordes of biding
With swikel tung ouer al ẏing
For ẏi god sal fordo ẏe
In end ẏe outlouk ẏar ẏou sal be
And ferre ẏe fro telde hisse
And ti rote fro erẏe ẏet liuand isse
Rightwise sa[l] se and dred ẏai sal
And lagh on him with al
And sai lok man here isse
Whilk noht set god to be help hisse
Bot he hoped in mikelhed of his richesse
And betered in his vnnaitnesse
And i als oliue fruit berand
In ẏe hous of Louerd dwelland
In godes merci hoped I
In werld and in werld of werld for ẏi
In werld tou made sal i to ẏe shriue
And i sal abide ẏi name mi liue
For is it in ẏi sight
Of ẏin haliyes ful of miht

l.quote: Dixit insipiens in corde suo [non est Deus]

lg.l: ẏe vnuise saide in his ẏhot
Dai andniht ẏat god is noht
ẏai are wemmed and mad wlatand
In wicnes ẏe whilk is god doand
Louerd of heuen ẏar he wones
Forthloked ouer men sones
ẏat ẏe wore he be vnderstand
Or whor ẏat he be god sekand
Al helded ẏai samen ẏare
vnnotful maked ẏai are
Whilk gode dos is tar none
Of ẏam alle to lepi on
ẏai [n]e sal wite al whilk wirk qued
Whil[k] [swol]iye mi folk als met of bred
God ne cald ẏai neuer one
ẏai qwok for dred ẏar dred was none
God scatred ẏar bones to men quem so
Shent are ẏai for god furwurth ẏo
Who of syon sal giue hele to irael
When Louerd had turned wrechednes ilkdele
Of his folk iacob glade sale
And faine sal irael with al

l.quote: Deus in nomine tuo salvum [me fac]

lg.l: God sauf me mak in name of ẏe
And in ẏe miht deme ẏou me
God here mi bede with eres ẏine
Bese ẏe wordes of mouth mine
For outen ros ogain me to go
And stalwur[th] shot mi saul to slo
Loke for ẏat god helpes me
And Louerd fonger of mi saule is he
Torn ẏou iuils in mi fos
And in sog[h]nes forlese ẏoos
Willi sal i offre to ẏe with blisse
And shriue to ẏi name Louerd for god it esse
For of al drouing ẏou me outtak
And mi fos min eye forsoke
God here mi bede with hert and ẏhot
And forsaken haue ẏou noht
Mi seking i make to ẏe
Behald to me and here me
Murned am i in bedgang
And to dreued i am amang
Of ẏe steuen of ẏe fo
For ẏai helded in me wicness ai
And in wragh to me hackand wor ẏai
Mi hert is dreued wicli in me to dwell
and raghnes of ded ouer me fell
Dred and quaking come ouer me
and mirkenes wof me ine to be
And i said who feẏeres mai gif me best
Als douue and i sal fleye and rest
Lok fleand lenẏed I
And in onnes i. I wones for ẏi
Whilk sau[f] made me i abode
Fro litelhed of gost and stormes brode
Fel neẏ[er] Louerd and twin in two
ẏe tunges ẏat are of ẏo
For i sagh ẏe wickednes
And te agaiynsaiyng in cite esse
Dai and niht sal ẏam vmgo
On ẏar walles wicnesse and wo
and swink in midde of ẏam be sal
And unrightwisnesse with al
And noht wanted of his wais to go
Oker and swicdom als so
For if weued had me mi fo
Soghlic ẏoled had i ẏo
And whilk if to ẏe hate me
Of me gretlic spoken had i. I
Swhilk ẏing miht haue betidde
ẏat i had me fro him hidde
Bot tou man o[f] wil nou
Mi duke and mi knawen are tou
Whilk samen swet metes tok ẏou with me so
In godes hous wele sal tou go
Come ded ouer am to qwelle
and liuand stigh ẏai doun in helle
For in ẏar teldes niht and wo
It is in middes of ẏo
Soghlic to louerd cried .I. I

His gast sal blaw and water sal outgo
ẏat shew his word to iacob wele
Songes and his domes til irael
Til al berẏe noht did he so
And his domes shewed he noht to ẏo

l.quote: Laudate Dominum de celis laudate eum

lg.l: Herẏe Louerd of heuen isse
In heghtes herẏes him with blisse
Herẏes him al his aungels be
Al his mightes him loue ẏe
Herẏes mune and sone bright
Herẏes him sternes and ẏe light
Loues him heuens of heuens ẏe same
And waters vnder heuens [Ps 148:5 Loue Louerdes name]
For he saide and mad ẏai ware
He send and shapen ẏai are
In ai and in werld of werld set he ẏo
He set bode ẏat sal noght forbi go
Loues Louerd of erẏe ẏat isse
Dragons and al hine depnesse
Fire als snaw is
Gast of stormes þat don ward isse
Hilles and alle knolles we calle
Tres fruitful and cedres alle
Bestes and al erẏes ẏo
Nedders foẏeles feẏered als so
Kinges of erẏe and al folk liuand
Princes and al demers of ẏe land
ẏonge man als so maidens clene
Aulde with ẏunger al bedene
Loue name of Louerd witerli
For vphouen is his name onli
His shriuet ouer heuen and erẏe with blis
And he vphoue horn of folk hisse
Ympne til his halẏes to sones irael
To folk him nerand neghand am del
Singes new song to Louerd with blisse
In kirke of halẏes hering hisse
Faine irael in him it made
And doghtres of sẏon in ẏar king sal glade
Loue ẏai in kouth krouth onan is name
And to him ẏai sing in sautre and tẏmpan
For wele quemed is to Louerd in folk hisse
And he vphoue fost in hele to blisse
Glade sal halẏes in blisse ai
And in ẏar kleeues faine sal ẏai
Gladnes of god in ẏrot of ẏo
Griping swerd in ẏar hend als so
In birẏes wrekes forto do
Snibbinges in mo folk ẏerto
To bind ẏar kinges in fotefesteles
Dome in ẏam writen þat do ẏai
Blisse ẏis til alle his halẏes ai

l.quote: Laudate Dominum in sanctis eius laudate

lg.l: Loues Louerd in his halẏes right
Herẏes him in wolken of his miht
Loues him in his ẏhewes more and lesse
Loues in mikelhed of his mikelnesse
In din of beme him loue ẏe

Loues him harp and
and
sautre
Herẏes him in croud and tẏmpan
Loues in strenges and organe
Euer loue ẏe him in lande
In chimbes ful wele ringande
Loues him in chimbes of mirẏe and blisse
